titleStmt.title: Description of British Library, Lansdowne Ch 666: Latin sale charter with a Hebrew docket

notesStmt.note: Part of the text missing due to water damage.

Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965 and Olszowy-Schlanger, Judith. Hebrew and Hebrew-Latin Documents from Medieval England: a diplomatic and Palaeographical Study. Turnhout: Brill, 2015.

msContents.summary: Latin sale charter with a Hebrew docket

msItem.title: Latin sale charter with a Hebrew docket

layoutDesc.layout: Columns: 1; ruled lines: 21; written lines: 21; The Hebrew text written beneath the Latin.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Latin Gothic script and Hebrew Ashkenazi documentary script of the 13th century.

history.provenance: Acquisition: William Petty (formerly Fitzmaurice) (b. 1737, d. 1805), 2nd earl of Shelburne and 1st marquess of Lansdowne, prime minister; purchased by the British Museum together with 1244 other Lansdowne manuscripts in 1807.
